Acompáñala en Madrid doña Ana Caro de Mayenne, dama de nuestra Sevilla, a quien se deben no menores alabanzas, pues con sus dulces y bien pensados versos suspende y deleita a quien los oye y lee. But, alas, that between two extremes you well know that I would be to pour dead blood, to feel a living arrow. O thou of my thoughts, idolized murderess, sweet spell of souls, sweet death of lives. If thou wilt not see, sir, the snow in dyed blood, if the rigor with which thou treatest me thou wilt not see in thyself, throw no more arrows so many at the target of my soul, for thou wilt shoot at thy hand if thou shoot at the target of the soul.
